trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights monitors your live application to help you [detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions][detect], and [discover how your app is used][knowUsers].
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights monitors your live application to help you [detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions][detect], and [discover how your app is used][knowUsers].

trans-unit.source: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.
trans-unit.target: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.

trans-unit.source: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.
trans-unit.target: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.

trans-unit.source: Example performance monitoring charts
trans-unit.target: Example performance monitoring charts

trans-unit.source: See also:
trans-unit.target: See also:

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET 5
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET 5

trans-unit.source: [Device apps and Java servers][platforms]
trans-unit.target: [Device apps and Java servers][platforms]

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: For many application types, [Visual Studio can add Application Insights to your app](#ide) almost without you noticing.
trans-unit.target: For many application types, [Visual Studio can add Application Insights to your app](#ide) almost without you noticing.

trans-unit.source: But since you're reading this to get a better understanding of what's going on, we'll take you through the steps manually.
trans-unit.target: But since you're reading this to get a better understanding of what's going on, we'll take you through the steps manually.

trans-unit.source: You need:
trans-unit.target: You need:

trans-unit.source: A subscription to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).
trans-unit.target: A subscription to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).

trans-unit.source: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your [Microsoft account](http://live.com).
trans-unit.target: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your [Microsoft account](http://live.com).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 or later.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 or later.

trans-unit.source: 1. Create an Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: 1. Create an Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal][portal], and create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal][portal], and create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Choose ASP.NET as the application type.
trans-unit.target: Choose ASP.NET as the application type.

trans-unit.source: Click New, Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Click New, Application Insights

trans-unit.source: A [resource][roles] in Azure is an instance of a service.
trans-unit.target: A [resource][roles] in Azure is an instance of a service.

trans-unit.source: This resource is where telemetry from your app will be analyzed and presented to you.
trans-unit.target: This resource is where telemetry from your app will be analyzed and presented to you.

trans-unit.source: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in [Metrics Explorer][metrics].
trans-unit.target: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in [Metrics Explorer][metrics].

trans-unit.source: Copy of the Instrumentation Key
trans-unit.target: Copy of the Instrumentation Key

trans-unit.source: The key identifies the resource, and you'll install it soon in the SDK to direct data to the resource.
trans-unit.target: The key identifies the resource, and you'll install it soon in the SDK to direct data to the resource.

trans-unit.source: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C
trans-unit.target: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C

trans-unit.source: The steps you've just done to create a new resource are a good way to start monitoring any application.
trans-unit.target: The steps you've just done to create a new resource are a good way to start monitoring any application.

trans-unit.source: Now you can send data to it.
trans-unit.target: Now you can send data to it.

trans-unit.source: 2. Install the SDK in your application
trans-unit.target: 2. Install the SDK in your application

trans-unit.source: Installing and configuring the Application Insights SDK varies depending on the platform you're working on.
trans-unit.target: Installing and configuring the Application Insights SDK varies depending on the platform you're working on.

trans-unit.source: For ASP.NET apps, it's easy.
trans-unit.target: For ASP.NET apps, it's easy.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages

trans-unit.source: Install Application Insights SDK for Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Install Application Insights SDK for Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Search for "Application Insights"
trans-unit.target: Search for "Application Insights"

trans-unit.source: Edit ApplicationInsights.config (which was added by the NuGet install).
trans-unit.target: Edit ApplicationInsights.config (which was added by the NuGet install).

trans-unit.source: Insert this just before the closing tag:
trans-unit.target: Insert this just before the closing tag:

trans-unit.source: `<InstrumentationKey>` *the instrumentation key you copied* `</InstrumentationKey>`
trans-unit.target: `<InstrumentationKey>` *the instrumentation key you copied* `</InstrumentationKey>`

trans-unit.source: (Alternatively, you can [set the key by writing some code][apikey] in your app.)
trans-unit.target: (Alternatively, you can [set the key by writing some code][apikey] in your app.)

trans-unit.source: To upgrade to future SDK versions
trans-unit.target: To upgrade to future SDK versions

trans-unit.source: We release a new version of the SDK from time to time.
trans-unit.target: We release a new version of the SDK from time to time.

trans-unit.source: To upgrade to a [new release of the SDK](app-insights-release-notes-dotnet.md), open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.
trans-unit.target: To upgrade to a [new release of the SDK](app-insights-release-notes-dotnet.md), open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.

trans-unit.source: Select **Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web** and choose **Upgrade**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web** and choose **Upgrade**.

trans-unit.source: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.
trans-unit.target: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.

trans-unit.source: 3. Run your project
trans-unit.target: 3. Run your project

trans-unit.source: Use the **F5** to run your application and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use the **F5** to run your application and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.

trans-unit.source: 4. View your telemetry
trans-unit.target: 4. View your telemetry

trans-unit.source: Return to the [Azure portal][portal] and browse to your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Return to the [Azure portal][portal] and browse to your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Look for data in the Overview charts.
trans-unit.target: Look for data in the Overview charts.

trans-unit.source: At first, you'll just see one or two points.
trans-unit.target: At first, you'll just see one or two points.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Click through to more data
trans-unit.target: Click through to more data

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about metrics.][perf]
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about metrics.][perf]

trans-unit.source: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.
trans-unit.target: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.

trans-unit.source: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.
trans-unit.target: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.

trans-unit.source: No data?
trans-unit.target: No data?

trans-unit.source: Open the [Search][diagnostic] tile, to see individual events.
trans-unit.target: Open the [Search][diagnostic] tile, to see individual events.

trans-unit.source: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Wait a few seconds and click **Refresh**.
trans-unit.target: Wait a few seconds and click **Refresh**.

trans-unit.source: Charts refresh themselves periodically, but you can refresh manually if you're waiting for some data to show up.
trans-unit.target: Charts refresh themselves periodically, but you can refresh manually if you're waiting for some data to show up.

trans-unit.source: See [Troubleshooting][qna].
trans-unit.target: See [Troubleshooting][qna].

trans-unit.source: Trouble on your build server?
trans-unit.target: Trouble on your build server?

trans-unit.source: Please see [this Troubleshooting item](app-insights-troubleshoot-faq.md#NuGetBuild).
trans-unit.target: Please see [this Troubleshooting item](app-insights-troubleshoot-faq.md#NuGetBuild).

trans-unit.source: 5. Add dependency tracking
trans-unit.target: 5. Add dependency tracking

trans-unit.source: The SDK needs a little help to get access to some data.
trans-unit.target: The SDK needs a little help to get access to some data.

trans-unit.source: In particular, you'll need this additional step in order to automatically measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.
trans-unit.target: In particular, you'll need this additional step in order to automatically measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.

trans-unit.source: These dependency metrics can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.
trans-unit.target: These dependency metrics can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.

trans-unit.source: If your app runs in your IIS server
trans-unit.target: If your app runs in your IIS server

trans-unit.source: Sign in to your server with admin rights, and install [Application Insights Status Monitor](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=506648).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your server with admin rights, and install [Application Insights Status Monitor](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=506648).

trans-unit.source: (You can also use Status Monitor to [instrument an app that's already running](app-insights-monitor-performance-live-website-now.md), even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)
trans-unit.target: (You can also use Status Monitor to [instrument an app that's already running](app-insights-monitor-performance-live-website-now.md), even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)

trans-unit.source: If your app is an Azure Web App
trans-unit.target: If your app is an Azure Web App

trans-unit.source: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.
trans-unit.target: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.

trans-unit.source: In your web app, Tools, Performance Monitoring, Add, Application Insights
trans-unit.target: In your web app, Tools, Performance Monitoring, Add, Application Insights

trans-unit.source: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.
trans-unit.target: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)
trans-unit.target: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)

trans-unit.source: 6. Add client-side monitoring
trans-unit.target: 6. Add client-side monitoring

trans-unit.source: You've installed the SDK that sends telemetry data from the server (back end) of your application.
trans-unit.target: You've installed the SDK that sends telemetry data from the server (back end) of your application.

trans-unit.source: Now you can add client-side monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Now you can add client-side monitoring.

trans-unit.source: This provides you with data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the client.
trans-unit.target: This provides you with data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the client.

trans-unit.source: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.
trans-unit.target: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.

trans-unit.source: If your clients are web browsers
trans-unit.target: If your clients are web browsers

trans-unit.source: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.
trans-unit.target: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.

trans-unit.source: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'
trans-unit.target: In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'

trans-unit.source: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about web page tracking.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about web page tracking.

trans-unit.source: If your clients are device apps
trans-unit.target: If your clients are device apps

trans-unit.source: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the [appropriate SDK](app-insights-platforms.md) to your device app.
trans-unit.target: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the [appropriate SDK](app-insights-platforms.md) to your device app.

trans-unit.source: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.
trans-unit.target: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.

trans-unit.source: 7. Complete your installation
trans-unit.target: 7. Complete your installation

trans-unit.source: To get the full 360-degree view of your application, there are a few more things you can do:
trans-unit.target: To get the full 360-degree view of your application, there are a few more things you can do:

trans-unit.source: [Set up web tests][availability] to make sure your application stays live and responsive.
trans-unit.target: [Set up web tests][availability] to make sure your application stays live and responsive.

trans-unit.source: [Capture log traces][netlogs] from your favorite logging framework
trans-unit.target: [Capture log traces][netlogs] from your favorite logging framework

trans-unit.source: [Track custom events and metrics][api] in client or server or both, to learn more about how your application is used.
trans-unit.target: [Track custom events and metrics][api] in client or server or both, to learn more about how your application is used.

trans-unit.source: The automated way
trans-unit.target: The automated way

trans-unit.source: We said at the beginning of this article that we'd show you the manual way to create a Application Insights resource, and then install the SDK.
trans-unit.target: We said at the beginning of this article that we'd show you the manual way to create a Application Insights resource, and then install the SDK.

trans-unit.source: We believe it's good to understand the two parts of that procedure.
trans-unit.target: We believe it's good to understand the two parts of that procedure.

trans-unit.source: But for ASP.NET apps (and many others) there's an even quicker automated way.
trans-unit.target: But for ASP.NET apps (and many others) there's an even quicker automated way.

trans-unit.source: You'll need [Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=397827&clcid=0x409) (2013 update 3 or later) and an account in [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).
trans-unit.target: You'll need [Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=397827&clcid=0x409) (2013 update 3 or later) and an account in [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).

trans-unit.source: If it's a new project...
trans-unit.target: If it's a new project...

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure **Add Application Insights** is selected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure **Add Application Insights** is selected.

trans-unit.source: Create an ASP.NET project
trans-unit.target: Create an ASP.NET project

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the `.config` file.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the `.config` file.

trans-unit.source: If your project has web pages, it also adds the [JavaScript SDK][client] to the master web page.
trans-unit.target: If your project has web pages, it also adds the [JavaScript SDK][client] to the master web page.

trans-unit.source: ... or if it's an existing project
trans-unit.target: ... or if it's an existing project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose **Add Application Insights**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose **Add Application Insights**.

trans-unit.source: Choose Add Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Choose Add Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the `.config` file.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the `.config` file.

trans-unit.source: In this case, it doesn't add the [JavaScript SDK][client] to your web pages - we recommend you do that as the next step.
trans-unit.target: In this case, it doesn't add the [JavaScript SDK][client] to your web pages - we recommend you do that as the next step.

trans-unit.source: Setup options
trans-unit.target: Setup options

trans-unit.source: If this is your first time, you'll be asked sign in or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first time, you'll be asked sign in or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.

trans-unit.source: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)
trans-unit.target: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)

trans-unit.source: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use **Configure settings** to put it in the same resource group as the other components.
trans-unit.target: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use **Configure settings** to put it in the same resource group as the other components.

trans-unit.source: No Application Insights option?
trans-unit.target: No Application Insights option?

trans-unit.source: Check that you're using Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later and that Application Insights Tools are enabled in Extensions and Updates.
trans-unit.target: Check that you're using Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later and that Application Insights Tools are enabled in Extensions and Updates.

trans-unit.source: Open Application Insights from your project
trans-unit.target: Open Application Insights from your project

trans-unit.source: Right-click your project and open the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Right-click your project and open the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Video
trans-unit.target: Video

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
